BookLibrary

Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • BookLibrary.Date

  • public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all the input Dates and Checks it's Validity. This Class also uses the Calendar Class through which we can get today's date.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Date()
      Creates an object with today’s date using Calendar class
      Date(java.lang.String date)
      Takes date as parameter in the mm/dd/yyyy format and creates a Date object

      • isLeapYear

        public boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        Checks if the date is a leap year
        Parameters:
        year - the year to be checked
        Returns:
        true if it is a leap year, false otherwise

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if the date is a valid date. For example, a future date, any date before the year 1900 is invalid
        Returns:
        true if it is a valid date, false otherwise

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Testbed Main Tests if the given dates are valid
        Parameters:
        args - the input argument
